unsolved: 3D exploration of large datasets such as LSFM dataset
use_cases_desc: Authors present the exploration of scientific visualizations such as Light Sheet Fluorescence Microscopy (LSFM) data as a use case.
contribution_desc: The paper presents an interaction technique for 3D exploration of time-series data (3D+t). The user can explore 3D content by moving a mobile device (i.e., a tablet) in space where the content is then presented as "2D slices" on the mobile screen. Further, users can bookmark slices for later use. An additional wall-sized screen can display multiple (bookmarked) views of the time-series data, and users can transfer views from the wall-sized screen to the mobile device and vice versa. The mobile device is tracked in 6DOF using an OptiTrack motion capture system to achieve the spatial navigation and exploration.
device_models: Google Nexus 7 (tablet); twelve 55″ displays with a total size of 5x2 meters and a resolution of 24 megapixels running Ubuntu
